DataElement.preferredName: Standard Deviation Imaging Mean Fluorescence Intensity Signal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to describe standard deviation of the mean fluorescence intensity value.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Imaging Mean Fluorescence Intensity Standard Deviation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set._Fluorescence is a luminescence (i.e., optical phenomenon) in cold bodies, in which a molecule absorbs a high-energy photon, and re-emits it as a lower-energy (longer-wavelength) photon. The energy difference between the absorbed and emitted photons ends up as molecular vibrations (heat)._The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling._A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.:Fluorescence is a luminescence (i.e., optical phenomenon) in cold bodies, in which a molecule absorbs a high-energy photon, and re-emits it as a lower-energy (longer-wavelength) photon. The energy difference between the absorbed and emitted photons ends up as molecular vibrations (heat).

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
The sum of a set of values divided by the number of values in the set.

Fluorescence is a luminescence (i.e., optical phenomenon) in cold bodies, in which a molecule absorbs a high-energy photon, and re-emits it as a lower-energy (longer-wavelength) photon. The energy difference between the absorbed and emitted photons ends up as molecular vibrations (heat).

Property.preferredDefinition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.:A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.

Concepts.definition: The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A detectable physical quantity or impulse (e.g., voltage, current, or magnetic field strength). (from Merriam Webster OnLine)_A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A detectable physical quantity or impulse (e.g., voltage, current, or magnetic field strength). (from Merriam Webster OnLine):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A detectable physical quantity or impulse (e.g., voltage, current, or magnetic field strength).
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support Duke University LUM015 Imaging CRF
